Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> But considering Komodo (including its community, developers, etc) is a decentralized project, I'm sure if people WANTED to pay for KMD listings on a specific exchange, they could certainly raise donations independently to do so! But Komodo funds that were initially raised won't be used that way.
I'm personally not against listing fees (assuming they are reasonable) (re @klimenko85: Thanks. I thought so. I just need this information for further distribution.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> For example if you know of a really good small exchange that caters to a certain region you want KMD to grow in, or you think would be a good fit, it might make sense to try and raise money to list there.
But the ICO funds are allocated almost entirely to paying dPoW costs.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <klimenko85> Of course, the fee for placement on low-liquid exchanges for Komodo is unreasonable.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Yea though if that exchange dominates a specific country's crypto trading market, it might be worth it. But not out of the Komodo dPoW funds. dPoW is far more important (re @klimenko85: Of course, the fee for placement on low-liquid exchanges for Komodo is unreasonable.)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <Regnar> Check your address here
https://www.atomicexplorer.com/#/rewards
I would also use the link about to check your address to make sure rewards are accruing. Locktime (the method of measuring how long rewards are accruing) is set on outgoing transactions, by the sending wallet. Some wallets just don't set this so the coins don't accrue rewards.
If this happens you can send your balance to yourself to set the locktime.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> Just a question if I stored kmd on paper wallet... Can I still get reward

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Yes. You have to claim it monthly though if you want to maximize rewards (re @efmartinez: Just a question if I stored kmd on paper wallet... Can I still get reward)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> Alright thanks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Rewards are more based on the sending wallet. The sending wallet sets locktime on the transaction, so it will accrue no matter the type of wallet it is in. However some wallets do not set locktime on their transactions by default. I think Coinomi doesn't. But MOST wallets do, and EVERY komodo ecosystem wallet does

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> What I mean is paper wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> So even if you get a transaction that isn't accruing rewards, you can send the transaction to yourself.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> Sending to paper wallet n keep it there for a while

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Yes this is what I mean, if you send FROM a wallet besides Coinomi, to a paper wallet, it will accrue rewards (re @efmartinez: Sending to paper wallet n keep it there for a while)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> Thanks clear

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> And then when you claim monthly, it all depends how you send from the paper. You likely import the key into some wallet to spend the coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> So importing into Agama, Chameleon, Magnum, atomicdex, pungo etc would be your best bet, then send it to a new paper wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <efmartinez> OK.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> But yea, paper wallet will accrue rewards, but claim it monthly to maximize rewards, and when you claim, use a Komodo ecosystem wallet so it will keep locktime set (re @efmartinez: OK.)
